**Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis**  
• **Frame 1**: No clearly visible pedestrians. The scene shows parked cars along the curb and some buildings, but no one on foot is apparent.  
• **Frame 2**: Essentially the same view straight ahead; still no pedestrians evident on the sidewalks.  
• **Frame 3**: Two people come into view on the right‐hand sidewalk near the corner (one wearing darker clothing, the other in red).  
• **Frame 4**: Those same two pedestrians remain visible on the right‐hand sidewalk.  
• **Frame 5**: Again, the same two pedestrians are visible on the right‐hand sidewalk; no additional pedestrians appear anywhere else in the frame.  

**Contextual Reasoning**  
Across the five frames, only those two pedestrians appear at any time, and they are consistently the same two individuals. No other pedestrians come into frame.

**Match to Answer Choices**  
• “0” or “1” does not match the observed two people.  
• “3” or “4” is unsupported by what the frames show.  
• “2” is exactly how many unique pedestrians are visible.

<answer>C. 2.</answer>
